title: Reduce Golang Binary Size by 20 Percent
description:
I first read about this on Shrink your go binaries with this one weird trick by Filippo Valsorda. That's from 2016, but I retested on golang 1.8.1 1.10.0.
Just add -ldflags="-s -w" to your build and watch the output size drop by 20%.
go build -ldflags="-s -w" This strips away a bunch of symbols that are only used by debuggers. If you don't use them, then everything else is the same, including panic stack traces.

title: Ticketmaster Demonstrates Cutting Edge Android Instant Apps Technology at Google I/O
description: It was a typical pleasant bright April day in Hollywood, CA but something  was in the air. Working with the very latest Instant App tools provided by Google, I was delighted to see the following message flash across my dark console, a first of its kind success for our Android development team: “Successfully pushed instant apps […]
